subject: Re: [junit] Junit's Importance
msgSnippet: 1. Standardization is generally a good thing... Using JUnit will begin some standard practice of unit testing in your organization 2. Ease of use 3.
messageBody:
1. Standardization is generally a good thing... Using JUnit will begin some standard practice of unit testing in your organization

2. Ease of use

3. AUTOMATED,AUTOMATED,AUTOMATED,AUTOMATED,AUTOMATED,AUTOMATED,AUTOMATED,AUTOMATED,AUTOMATED,AUTOMATED!

4. JUnit is also (by de facto) a standard for unit testing in the Java world (also, it's easily integrateable with Ant)

5. Related to #2, because it is so easy to use, it may not be such a hard thing to get developers to write tests. Tests tend to be written as after thoughts and not as part of general development; because of this the tests are generally harder to write and thus never written. And, if they are written, they tend to be incomplete!

6. Related to #3, because it is so easy to use, developers may not be so hesitant to write tests *as they go along*, helping to enforce good design.

There are many more reasons. Most, are just reasons for writing unit tests in general. I don't know how anyone can stand to develop any other way! I know I can't!

=jason
